newsitem.title: USA: Excite says Intuit deal takes place of stock sale.
newsitem.headline: Excite says Intuit deal takes place of stock sale.

text.p: Excite Inc chief executive George Bell said Wednesday that Intuit Inc's $40 million investment in Excite "supplants" Excite's planned secondary stock offering.
"We were doing it in a choppy market that was getting choppier," Bell said during a conference call. "We are adequately capitalized now."
Excite, which operates search sites on the Internet, had planned to raise money by offering an additional 2.3 million shares.

Earlier today, financial software company Intuit agreed to pay $40 million to buy a 19 percent stake in Excite. The companies said they will work together to develop Web sites that help consumers manage their finances.
